intro: Scrophularia farakulumensis, commonly known as the Farakulum scrophularia, is a perennial herb native to specific regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their medicinal properties. The plant typically features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, with flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological and pharmacological significance.
